subject: Communication
title: EQ Across the Lifespan
description: A quick, practical guide to EQ Across the Lifespan.

hook.text: Children have tantrums. Teenagers slam doors. Adults send passive-aggressive emails. EQ develops over a lifetime.

buildup.text: Emotional intelligence isn't fixed at birth. Brain regions governing EQ continue developing into your mid-twenties.

discovery.text: Research shows EQ generally increases with age. Older adults score higher on emotional regulation than young adults.

twist.text: But aging alone isn't enough. Without deliberate practice, some adults never develop beyond adolescent emotional.

climax.text: At any age, EQ can improve with practice: mindfulness, journaling, feedback-seeking, and therapy all build capacity.

punchline.text: It's never too late to grow your emotional intelligence.

quiz.question: Does emotional intelligence generally increase with age?
